vsc-webshark.sharkdFullPath.description: Full path incl. file to the Wireshark - sharkd binary. e.g. for OSX: /Applications/Wireshark.app/Contents/MacOS/sharkd

vsc-webshark.tsharkFullPath.description: Full path incl. file to the Wireshark - tshark binary. e.g. for OSX: /Applications/Wireshark.app/Contents/MacOS/tshark or for win: c:\program files\Wireshark\tshark.exe

vsc-webshark.mergecapFullPath.description: Full path incl. file to the Wireshark - mergecap binary. e.g. for OSX: /Applications/Wireshark.app/Contents/MacOS/mergecap or for win: c:\program files\Wireshark\mergecap.exe

displayFilter.description: Wireshark display filter string used to identify this event.

items.description: Wireshark sharkd column expression like %Yut or <displayfilter>:<occurrence>. Values can be used for label or for timeSync feature.

conversionFunction.description: Optional parameter that need to be a proper JS function. It gets passed the 'values' array as argument and needs to return a string that is used as timeSync value. E.g. "return values.join(':');". If not provided values with be concated by ' '.

label.description: Label of this event. Can contain {x} format expressions that are replaced by x.th (1-based) values (see values). If empty (or {0}) defaults to the info column.

level.description: Indent level (1-based) of this event. Level 1 events are the upmost ones. Level 0 wont be added to tree-view but can be used for timeSync.

timeSyncId.description: Optional identifier of a 'time sync event'. This gets broadcasted to other documents with the time and the first value in lower case

timeSyncPrio.description: Optional (needed if timeSyncId is used) priority of the time-sync event. As two documents exchange their events by this prio they decide on who will adjust the time. The event with the highest prio (lowest number) will be used.

staticItems.description: Optional items that are added to the quick pick for this step.

key.description: Will be shown in first column and used as param to filterField.

filterField.description: tshark filter field that will be used with key.

icon.description: Optional codicon icon that will be added for this item. E.g. $(globe)

listProvider.description: Optional tshark based list provider arguments that executes the filter in the background and provides quick pick items. It's an array of array as multiple queries can be piped (thark ... | thark ... ). This is usefull if e.g. on the first one a wireshark config (-C ...) is used that has most plugins disabled and is a lot faster.

listProviderOptions.description: Optional options for the list provider. Currently 'groupBy' is supported. See example.

groupBy.description: Options to group items. E.g. frame time per min.

groupFn.description: Javascript function body that has to return a string based on parameter 'col0'. E.g. 'return Math.trunc(Number(col0)/30).toString()'

justOneValue.description: Determines whether just the first value creating the group should be kept or all values. Set to 'true' e.g. for frame time grouping.

listIcon.description: Optional codicon icon for the provided elements.

filterField.description: Tshark filter field that will be used with the first column results from the listProvider.

filterOp.description: Optional operator to be used to compare filterField. If not specified '==' is used.

filterArgs.description: Optional tshark arguments that will be provided on filter execution. Usefull e.g. to provide a minimal/fast wireshark config.

filterNegate.description: Can be used to 'remove' items. If used the filter is created with !(filterField==key or filterField==key...). If not set the default is filterField==key or ...

default.title: select all MAC addresses to keep
select UDP destination ports (udp.dstport) to remove
select TCP destination ports (tcp.dstport) to remove
enter any additional (can be empty) display filter expression

vsc-webshark.filterSteps.description: Steps offered for the 'Filter pcap file...' function

vsc-webshark.extractDltArgs.description: Arguments used for tshark. Should contain timestamp as epoch and hexdump of dlt message payload

It's an array of array as multiple queries can be piped (thark ... | thark ... ). This is usefull if e.g. on the first one a wireshark config (-C ...) is used that has most plugins disabled and is a lot faster.

filterNegate.description: Can be used to 'remove' items. If used the filter is created with !(filterField==key or filterField==key...). If not set the default is filterField==key or ...

default.title: enter udp.dstport with the DLT data to export
select all MAC addresses with the DLT data to export

vsc-webshark.extractDltSteps.description: Steps offered for the 'Extract DLT from pcap file...' function

vsc-webshark.removeTecmpArgs.description: Arguments used for tshark. Should contain timestamp as epoch and hexdump of encapsulated frame payload
